result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph P. Lang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
Concurrent with: Probation on counts 1&3 to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling/programing as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  

Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  

The defendant shall have no contact with Kayla Meeker  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way for the first 6 months of probation after which contact is at the descrition of the agent.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant granted credit for 56 days served . Defendant granted huber priveleges. Jail sentence applies to count 1 only.
